Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Aurein 2.2 (natural AMPs; XXA, UCLL1c; frog, amphibians, animals; BBMm)
Sequence Information.Source: Southern bell frogLitoria aureaorLitoria raniformis, Australia

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against B. cereus (MIC 100 ug/ml), E.coli (MIC >100 ug/ml), L. lactis (MIC 12 ug/ml), L. innocua (MIC 12 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC 25 ug/ml), P.multocida (MIC > 100 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 25 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 50 ug/ml), and S. uberis (MIC 100 ug/ml) (provided by Chunfeng Wang and validated GW).  Contains: Aurein 2.2.1 (residue 3 to 16);Structure: C-terminal NH2. Solution NMR in 25% TFE established a helical structure (Pan Y et al 2007 Biophys J 92: 2854).MOA:bacteria:B. subtilis: forming a small pore, triggering the release of certain metal ions and causing membrane depolarization (Wenzel et al., 2015).Updated 9/2017; 7/2021; 4/2024
Literature Information.Author: Rozek T, Wegener KL, Bowie JH, Olver IN, Carver JA, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.2000, Australia
Literature Information.Title: The antibiotic and anticancer active aurein peptides from the australian bell frogs Litoria aurea and Litoria raniformis the solution structure of aurein 1.2.
